title: Portfolio Website
highlights: Created a consistent, front-end design for a website
Implemented various features into the website, including filtering, mobile view, and more
Utilized open source libraries to effeciently solve problems
Utilized a template library to provide automatic generation of pages provided data without any extra coding necessary

title: Triton Gaming
highlights: Planned large scale events for the gaming community at UCSD
Created multiple organizational frameworks to allow consistency between events
Led the teams responsible for general logistics and inventory management for multiple events
Created systems to keep track of dozens of pieces of equipment without losing anything
Managed and moderated the community Discord server of 4,500+ members

title: UC San Diego Computer Science Department
highlights: Tutored for three classes: CSE 12 - Basic Data Structures and Object-Oriented Design, CSE 100 - Advanced Data Structures, and CSE 142L - Software Project for Computer Architecture
Held office hours to assist over 400 students
Worked to help students through theoretical misconceptions, code problems, and general questions
Created resources, such as automatic run debugging, to aid in students' development
Assisted in the course's Discussion section to enhance the learning process

title: Chairiots: A 3D Networked Game in Rust
highlights: Created a 3D, real time, 4 player video game in 10 weeks without an engine
Collaborated with others in order to produce a product based on a specification
Learned a new programming language to adapt to the group's decisions
Added additional functionality to our engine to implement desired features into the game
Designed multiple 'racechairs', each with different strengths and weaknesses and game feels

title: AmpliPy: Python Variant Calling
highlights: Researched COVID-19 genomics, and how to track the spread of the disease through a population
Reviewed old code in order to understand its purpose, ineffeciencies, and algorithms
Reimplemented the algorithms in Python in order to eliminate ineffeciencies resulting in a 50% reduction in runtime
Worked with Professors and other students to complete the program and refine an associated paper
Wrote a paper summarizing the project to capstone it, which can be found below

title: League of Tritons
highlights: Planned events catering towards the League of Legends community at UCSD

Managed and moderated the community Discord

title: UC San Diego Esports - League of Legends

Provided Play by Play shotcalling, live analysis of game state, and retroactive insight into plays
Participated in a live environment with others
Stayed calm under pressure and kept up with the high stakes, speedy gameplay
Supported my fellow casters they, and relied on them when I, were in need of assistance

title: Computer Science & Engineering Summer Program for Incoming Students

Gave advice, help, and support to students as they adjusted to college life and work for the first time
Assisted with the students' project, giving advice about how best to solve the problems they faced
Worked with students to help them solve the problems they faced as they coded
Interacted with the students in fun activities to keep them engaged in the program and excited to start
Updated and managed a Python Discord bot in order to assist in the day-to-day of the camp
urls: Previous Projects (not currently up to date with this years')

Implemented features into the app with Javascript, including a modular settings menu and sound effects
Participated in weekly reflections, sprints, and planning meetings
Reviewed other students' code and assisted in bug hunting, solving, and advice when they were stuck.

title: Robotics Club Programming

Utilized hardware added by other members in code to make it functional
Won multiple awards, including for the hardware and software of the robot, awards at regional competitions
Worked as the Lead Developer for all four years
Led as President of the club during my final year
